page.title: 07LEIGH
page.content: {Leigh}is a small village whose houses are scattered along each side of one main road and several lanes. There are small cottages which are over two hundred years old and local authority houses. On the edge of the village is a {Riding School}with twentyone horses. There is also a small home industry where a husband and wife team work as craft design engineers, producing work needing high precision. These, along with the farms and school, provide a limited amount of employment. The School, built in 1894, has just two classrooms with a total of twentyfive children, aged five to eleven years. The old school house is now an {Outdoor Education Centre}where Wiltshire school children camp. The{Women's Institute}meet in the school once a month.
